page.title: 17Nuclear Dumping
page.content: When a firm called NIREX wanted to dump nuclear waste under Billingham a meeting was held. A committee called BAND (Billingham against Nuclear Dumping) was formed and given an office in the town centre to plan events. The first was a march around ICI with thousands of people joining in. A petition against the proposal was signed by 83 000 people. The petition was handed in to the Prime Minister. An answer was promised before Christmas 1984 but it was January 1985 before it was announced that BAND had won it's fight and the proposals were withdrawn.
